title: Error 500 while authenticating Gmail with OAuth2
content: This morning, Thunderbird started asking me to log into my Gmail account out of the blue. After pressing Next, the same page opened in Firefox, and after selecting my account there and pressing Next, I simply got a generic page with the title "500. That's an error" and a simple text asking me to try again later. No matter what I do, even trying different browsers, the result is the same. I can access Gmail through Firefox without problem, and my Gmail account worked just fine yesterday with Thunderbird. I have not changed Thunderbird's configuration for months, and OAuth2 authentication has worked without problem since I activated it back in 2022. What can I do?
creator: ajgelado

title: Issues with thunderbird email
content:
I have a persistent issue with my 'Sent' folder on my thunderbird email account. When I send an email to someone, in the Sent folder it inaccurately reports who the email has been sent to. Usually, it says the email has been send to the previous person I've emailed, even though it hasn't. Can you help in fixing this?

I have attached a screenshot illustrating the issue.

Many thanks in advance
creator: Fuffyfuffy

title: Prevent Compact folder from compacting subfolders
content:
Since the dawn of time, the Compact folder command on the folder context menu has compacted just the selected folder. However, I have noticed that in the latest Thunderbird version (I'm using 115.6.1) the Compact folder starts automatically compacting all subfolders under the current one. This is a big problem for me: under the inbox, which I need to compact fairly often because all messages pass through it, I have literally hundreds of subfolders, some of them dating from more than 20 years ago, when I used Netscape Communicator. Those folders are "read only" (I only have them for reference), and I do not want to modify them in any way, to avoid risking their contents. Thus, I DO NEED for Thunderbird to stop compacting subfolders automatically. Is it possible? How can it be done?

Also, after a folder compacting has started, what's the best way of cancelling it, short of closing Thunderbird? I understand that the compaction process is quite safe, as it copies all data to a fresh file, but would rather not risk data loss.
creator: ajgelado

title: Re-establishing Email Accounts
content:
I'm having trouble re-establishing email accounts in Thunderbird. I managed to drop them in the process of going to version 115; I don't know how but I did.

Now when I try to add them back I can get through the process (Tools > Account Settings > Account Actions > Add E-Mail Account) and enter the user name, email address, and mail server names and port settings for the various domains I use. All goes well until the final phase when it tries to validate the password. The final message says "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password."

I've done everything I know to do to fix this. I've changed passwords, checked, re-checked, verified, checked re-checked and re-verified the domain's POP3 and SMTP server names and port addresses all to no avail. I'm having trouble with my ISP's (grandecommunications purchased by Astound Communications) support on issues with email addresses that use their domain (@mygrande.net) but I'm also having the same problem with gmail domain (@gmail.com) addresses.

I would abandon the email addresses if it weren't for the fact that some of the email on servers is critical and needs to be downloaded to my system. Also, I can't log in to some accounts because the companies use 2-step authentication that involves sending codes to my email addresses instead of codes texted to my phone. This has reached near crisis proportions as I cannot reach those companies except online which requires 2-step authentication using those email addresses that I cannot set up again in Thunderbird.

I'm willing to take screenshots at each step if that will be helpful. I'm afraid that I've dealt with the problem for so long that I'm making the same mistake repeatedly but not recognizing that I'm doing so.

Any help will be greatly appreciated.
creator: rabbithutch1

title: Thunderbird'de bazı e-postaların gelmemesi
content:
İyi çalışmalar,

Thunderbird uygulamasında bazı e-postalar elimize ulaşmıyor. Böyle bir sıkıntım var. Kurum e-postası kullanıyorum. Sadece ben kullanmıyorum. Birkaç idareci de kullanıyor. Kullandığım e-posta: 756438@meb.k12.tr Sorun bizde mi yoksa başka birisi bir e-postayı okursa posta diğer kullanıcılara ulaşmıyor mu?
creator: emrebesim123

title: current command did not succeed mail server responded unknown source folder
content:
Full error message: The current command did not succeed.The mail server for account condobloke@gmail.comresponded : Unknown source folder (failure) History: out of the blues a group(18) folders decided to shift camp...instead pof being where they usually are in my list....they were found a further few inches down the page. All the info they contain is still there. The trash folder has been replaced by a "bin"...this is not a problem it just begs the question...why ?

Earlier today I received a message from google saying "schedule archive of google data started for condobloke gmail.com....and it marked the time and date that was initiated as today at 14:47pm

I did not initiate this. So, i changed my password (16 characters)....lengthened it 28. No one else has access to my passwords. No one.

In the middle of changing password and getting the show on the road again, I received an email from google asking me to confirm that I was allowing Thunderbird access to my gmail. (I usually see that when I am setting up a fresh gmail account and accessing that via Thunderbird.....I set up Thunderbird on 4 pc's in the house) "Mozilla Thunderbird Email Has access to Gmail, Google Calendar, Google Contacts"....The alternative email for your account was removed. If you didn't remove it, you should check what happened.""

The alternative account they are speaking about is condobloke@gmail.com I have one other account which is apparently unscathed So, condobloke etc has been reinstated....successfully. new password "" Google Mozilla Thunderbird Email was granted access to your linked Google Account condobloke@gmail.com

I can always wait to see if something comes down the line from google overnight.....maybe reinstating the arrangement of my folders?....that just might be wishful thinking !

I dont mind admitting I am a bit lost.

Brian
creator: condobloke1

title: recent repeated download of inbox
content:
I've been a Thunderbird user for almost 20 years. About a month ago (in December 2023), Thunderbird suddenly started downloading all messages in my inbox again. It now does so periodically about every week. Every time TB downloads my entire inbox again, it grinds to a hold and becomes unusable for a couple of hours.

I'm now running TB version 115.6 on Mac OS. I've never had this problem before. Googling the problem produces answers for POP mail, but I'm downloading from IMAP.
creator: streifi

title: Thunderbird operation.
content: There was a change of format a few weeks ago & the programme has not worked well since. It is painfully slow to load, & i have to log into my address book before I can open my messages. Just to make things worse, for the last 2 days Thunderbird has been randomly & frequently freezing. What's going on?
creator: allan_raewyn

title: Signing emails with S/MIME cert fails, I cant undertand why
content:
Hello,

Ive installed a MIME-certificate from Sectigo in Thunderbird 115.6.1 on Pop OS (flatpak).

The cert is in a pw-protected .p12-file which I have imported successfully. However when I try to sign emails I get the error-message shown in the first attached image. That the application cant find my cert or that it has expired. Both statements are incorrect imo :)

In attached image 2 and 3 it shows that the application has imported the cert and that its valid until 2025.

Any tips or input is helpful.

Also under Security Devices I have a PKCS#11 module that I have logged in to, but I dont see how that could affect PKCS#12 certs but I read in some guide that I had to do that. Which also apparently mean that master password is set for protecting credentials in the application, so I have to provide that password when opening Tunderbird.
creator: Dain_547647

title: Thunderbird blocks EMail send
content:
I am just setting up a test-email-server. The problem is, that thunderbird does not let me semd a mail to it. I always receive the error: 

   SMTP error from remote mail server after pipelined end of data:    550 5.7.0 bad DKIM signature data

But DKIM is correct. I can send to my mail from any other source (webmail, gmail, hotmail, outlook). What ever I tried - no error at all.

Only my local installation (thunderbird 115.6.1 64-Bit) is reacting this way. Any idea? Thx Gerald

title: Thunderbird 115 update crashes on Win 10 PC
content: Since the latest thunderbird update 115 I have multiple crashes & black screens, before this it was very stable. I have been using this since 2015 I think with little problem until now. If nobody else is having problems with 115 perhaps I should just use windows restore to go back to Dec 10th 2023. The only alteration to settings I made to try and fix it was to untick "use hardware acceleration when available". It made no difference.

title: Thunderbird email from Gmail - where are the emails stored on the computer?
content:
I came across this message from March 2022 -

"I read at AskLeo that I could use Thunderbird with Gmail as a way to backup my Gmail emails to my computer. I then want to backup the Thunderbird folder using a backup program to save the emails to an external drive.

On Windows 10 Home, where do I find the emails that Thunderbird is downloading from Gmail? I recently installed Thunderbird 102.1.0 (64-bit) using IMAP and OAuth2 authentication. "

which describes my problem well.

The answer relates to Windows 10, but I am using Linux Mint. I think I installed Thunderbird flatpack version but I cannot find the profile to backup and although I think all my emails (around 25,000) were downloaded from gmail, I cannot find them and so cannot take a backup.
creator: jvwhyte

title: Newer Thunderbird (>91.9.1) versions do not create Local Folders with fresh installation without a pre-existing profile.
content: I have noticed by installing Thunderbird 115.6.1 on a fresh PC that once installed there are no Local Folders. I am used to Thunderbird always automatically creating Local Folders. The person I was setting the PC up needs to access the emails store in an MBOX file and with Local Folders that was always so easy to do. Now the Local Folders are not created automatically and I can't find an option to create them anywhere in the menus. I tested the following Thunderbird versions: - Thunderbird Setup 91.9.1 (Local Folders are created automatically) - Thunderbird Setup 101.0b4 (Local Folders are NOT created automatically) - Thunderbird Setup 110.0b4 (Local Folders are NOT created automatically) - Thunderbird Setup 115.6.1 (Local Folders are NOT created automatically)
creator: obal.goran
